topicSummary: Psychosis is a disordered mental state characterized principally by positive symptoms such as hallucinations, delusions, and thought disorder.

topicHtmlObjects.htmlHeader: Psychosis and schizophrenia: Summary

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Information added on reported cases of misuse and abuse with quetiapine ABPI, 2016.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Diplopia added as an uncommon side effect with aripiprazole based on an update to the Summary of Product Characteristics (SPC) ABPI Medicines Compendium, 2014.

latestChanges.title: Reviewed
latestChanges.body: A literature search was conducted in March 2014 to identify evidence-based guidelines, UK policy, systematic reviews, and key RCTs published since the last revision of this topic. The following changes have been made in line with the NICE guideline Psychosis and schizophrenia in adults: treatment and management National Collaborating Centre for Mental Health, 2014:
